full_script module¶

Sample full_script.py¶

This script is intended to be a single-stop shop for performing analysis on this project.

As you write code, compartmentalize logical sections within functions and/or scripts as needed.

This module is where you’ll plug all the disparate pieces together so someone can execute the full suite in one go.

Examples¶

>>> # This is where you'd put some sample commands
>>> # Line 2 of the code example
full_script.load_shapefiles()[source]¶

This is a basic single-line docstring explaining what this function does

full_script.main()[source]¶
full_script.update_value(table_name, column_name, old_val, new_val)[source]¶

This is a long-form doctring, with room for multi-line explanation.

This function updates a column in a PgSQL table, replacing old_val with the new_val

Parameters

  • table_name – ‘name_of_table’

  • column_name – ‘name_of_col’

  • old_val – any value that matches the data type of column_name

  • new_val – any value that matches the data type of column_name

Returns
